intro: Deuteromallotus capuronii, commonly known as the Cape mountain thorn, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers that are followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Deuteromallotus capuronii is adapted to arid conditions and is relatively drought-tolerant.
